recipes.name: Thai Chicken and Yellow Rice with Crispy Shallots (Kao Moke Gai)
ingredients: Additional vegetable oil for frying shallots
5 slices gingerroot (about the size of a US quarter)
2 cups jasmine rice (or long-grain white rice, not instant or parboiled)
3 fresh green serrano chilies, thinly sliced
Fresh cilantro leaves, stems removed, rinsed, and dried
directions: 1. Combine cayenne pepper, cumin, coriander, turmeric, white pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt in a small bowl.
2. Rub half of the spice mixture onto the chicken thighs.
3. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
4. Brown the chicken, skin-side down, for 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally.
5. Remove the chicken and set aside.
6. Leave about 2 tablespoons of oil in the Dutch oven, then sauté the ginger slices for 30 seconds.
7. Add garlic and sauté until golden brown (30-45 seconds). Deglaze with water if needed.
8. Add onion and the remaining spice mixture. Sauté for 1 minute.
9. Add rice and toss until coated with oil. Add water and 1 1/2 teaspoons of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
10. Return the chicken to the pot, burying it under the rice. Add any accumulated chicken juices.
11. Cover and cook over low heat for 30 minutes.
12. While the chicken and rice cook, heat 2 inches of vegetable oil in a wok or skillet.
13. Fry the sliced shallots until golden brown. Remove and drain on paper towels.
14. Combine vinegar, sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt in a bowl to make the sauce. Add chili slices.
15. Once the rice is cooked, let it rest for 15 minutes.
16. Remove the chicken from the rice, fluff the rice, and discard the ginger slices.
17. Arrange the chicken and rice on a serving platter. Garnish with cucumber slices, cilantro, and crispy shallots. Serve with the sauce.

cooking_tips: Be careful when handling turmeric, as it can stain.
Deglaze the pot with water if the garlic starts to brown too quickly.
Use jasmine rice for a more authentic flavor, or substitute with long-grain white rice.
Adjust the amount of chili peppers to your preferred level of spiciness.

recipes.name: Chicken Rice Balls (Onigiri)
ingredients: 1/2 pound chicken thigh meat, finely chopped (or ground dark chicken meat)
directions: Step 1: Rinse the sushi rice in cool water until the water runs clear. Place the rice in a rice cooker or pot with 1 1/2 cups of water and salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let it sit, covered, for 5 minutes. Uncover, stir, and let cool. To speed up cooling, spread the rice on a baking sheet or tray.
Step 2: While the rice cooks, finely chop the chicken thighs (if using instead of ground chicken).

Step 3: In a medium saucepan, combine the chicken, soy sauce, sake, and mirin. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the liquid is almost completely absorbed.
Step 4: Let the chicken mixture cool to room temperature.  To speed up cooling, spread it in a thin layer on a baking sheet or tray.
Step 5: Combine the cooled rice and chicken mixture thoroughly.
Step 6: If using seaweed, crumble it into the rice and chicken mixture and mix well.
Step 7: With damp hands, take a small handful of the chicken-rice mixture and shape it into a ball or patty.

Step 8: Place the formed rice ball on a plate and repeat with the remaining mixture.  Re-wet your hands between each ball to prevent sticking. Cover the chicken rice balls and let them sit for a bit before eating, or chill them for later.

Adjust the amount of soy sauce to taste.
Serve with a side of pickled ginger or Japanese mayonnaise.

recipes.name: Spicy Yogurt-Marinated Turkish Grilled Chicken with Orzo Pilaf
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: 1. In a bowl, combine the yogurt, grated jalapeños, minced garlic, lemon zest, lemon juice, and cumin. Mix well.
2. Add the chicken thighs to the yogurt mixture, ensuring they are fully coated. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes, or preferably overnight.
3. While the chicken marinates, prepare the orzo pilaf. Rinse the rice in a fine-mesh sieve under cold water until the water runs clear.
4. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the orzo and toast, stirring frequently, until golden brown, about 3 minutes.
5. Add the rinsed rice to the saucepan and stir to combine with the toasted orzo.
6. Pour in the chicken broth, ensuring the liquid covers the rice by about 1 inch. Add 1 teaspoon of salt and the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Stir well.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes, or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked through.
8. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the rice rest, covered, for 10 minutes.
9. Heat a grill pan or outdoor grill over medium heat.
10. Season the marinated chicken thighs with salt and pepper.
11. Grill the chicken for 3-5 minutes per side, or until cooked through and slightly charred.
12. Serve the grilled chicken over the orzo pilaf.

recipes.name: Hibachi Chicken with Fried Rice and Sesame-Soy Bean Sprouts

ingredients.item: chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces

directions: 1. Prepare the ingredients: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces, thinly slice one white onion, quarter the zucchini, chop the other half of the white onion. Have the cooled rice ready.

2. Cook the chicken: Heat vegetable oil and sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken, soy sauce, butter, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Sauté for 6-8 minutes, or until cooked through.

3. Cook the vegetables: In a separate skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil and sesame oil over medium-high heat. Add sliced white onion, zucchini, butter, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Sauté for 6-8 minutes, or until tender-crisp.

4. Make the fried rice: Use the skillet or wok you cooked the chicken in. Heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion and sauté for 3-4 minutes, until softened. Add 1 cup bean sprouts and sauté for 1-2 minutes. Push vegetables to the side, add eggs, and scramble lightly. Add rice and butter, cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Add soy sauce and cook for 1 more minute.
5. Cook the bean sprouts: In the skillet or wok used for vegetables, melt butter. Add soy sauce and 3 cups bean sprouts. Sauté for 1-2 minutes.
6. Serve immediately: Combine chicken, vegetables, fried rice, and bean sprouts and serve hot.

recipes.name: Cajun Chicken Cauliflower Rice Bowls with Mangoes and Avocado
ingredients: 6(1.5 pounds, total)  boneless, skinless chicken thighs
1  tablespoon  cajun seasoning,  add more if you like it spicier or just adjust to taste
Salt and fresh ground pepper,  to taste
1  red bell pepper,  seeded, thinly sliced
1  tablespoon  extra virgin olive oil  (add more if you want/need to thin out the dressing)
Chopped fresh cilantro or parsley,  for garnish
FOR THE CHICKEN 6(1.5 pounds, total)  boneless, skinless chicken thighs  1  tablespoon  cajun seasoning,  add more if you like it spicier or just adjust to taste  1  tablespoon  vegetable oil
FOR THE CAULIFLOWER RICE 1/2  tablespoon  vegetable oil  4  cups  cauliflower rice  salt and fresh ground pepper,  to taste
FOR THE TOPPINGS 1  avocado,  peeled and sliced  1  red bell pepper,  seeded, thinly sliced  1  mango,  peeled, chopped  1/2  red onion,  diced

FOR THE LIME DRESSING 1/4  cup  plain yogurt  1  tablespoon  extra virgin olive oil  (add more if you want/need to thin out the dressing)  2  tablespoons  lime juice  1/2  teaspoon  lime zest  1  tablespoon  chopped fresh cilantro,  optional  1  teaspoon  white wine vinegar  1  teaspoon  honey  1  garlic cloves,  minced  salt and fresh ground pepper,  to taste  sliced green onions,  for garnish  chopped fresh cilantro or parsley,  for garnish
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Season chicken thighs with cajun seasoning and add to the skillet. DO NOT crowd the pan - for best results, cook in 2 batches.
Cook chicken thighs for 5 minutes; flip and continue to cook 7 more minutes, or until no longer pink.
Remove from skillet and set aside for 5 minutes before serving.
*You can also follow my recipe for ROASTED Cajun Chicken Thighs.
Add 1/2 tablespoon vegetable oil and heat over medium-high heat.
Stir in cauliflower rice, season with a bit of salt and pepper, and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, or until tender, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat and set aside to cool for few minutes.
In a mixing bowl combine yogurt, olive oil, lime juice, lime zest, cilantro, vinegar, honey, garlic, salt and pepper; whisk until well combined. Taste for seasonings and adjust accordingly.
Divide a layer of the Cauliflower Rice among 4 pasta bowls.
Top with sliced chicken, avocado slices, pepper slices, chopped mango, and diced onions.
Drizzle the prepared Dressing over the chicken, fruits, and vegetables.
Garnish with sliced green onions and cilantro/parsley.
Serve.

recipes.name: Slow Cooker Southwest Chicken and Rice
directions: Sprinkle skin side of chicken well with 1 tablespoon of southwest seasoning
Melt butter and oil in skillet (or multi cooker) over medium to high heat
Add chicken skin side down and let sizzle for 5-6 minutes or until chicken is nicely browned. Don't move while it's cooking to keep the chicken in good contact with the pan for a nice brown crust.
Remove chicken from pan and add rice to remaining oil/butter in pan
Saute while stirring for 2-3 minutes until rice is just lightly toasted
Add rice to slow cooker along with onion powder, garlic powder and 1 teaspoon of southwest seasoning
Stir in tomato sauce and chicken broth
Add chicken on top skin side up
Cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours or low for 6-8 or until chicken is fully cooked through
Remove chicken and stir rice well
If rice is not fully cooked you may add another ½ cup water or broth and let continue to cook on high for another 15-30 minutes

recipes.name: Chicken with Rice
directions: Start by peeling and finely chopping the ginger.
For the marinade, combine the soy sauce with the white wine and ginger.
Remove the excess fat from the thighs and place the chicken in a bowl.
Pour the marinade over the chicken and massage it into the chicken with your fingers. Let the chicken marinate in the fridge for up to 2 hours.
Shortly before the end of the marinating time, preheat the oven to 175°C / 350°F.
Cut the onion into rings and the lemon into slices.
Heat the olive oil in an oven-safe pan or a large pot and cook the chicken thighs on each side for approx. 5 minutes. Save the remaining marinade for later.
Set the chicken thighs to the side and fry the onion rings and lemon slices for approx. 5 minutes until they turn a light brown.
Lay the chicken on top of the onions and lemons, drizzle with the remaining marinade and cook in the oven for approx. 40 minutes.
Prepare the rice according to the package instructions and finely chop the parsley.
Split the rice onto two plates, top with the chicken and garnish with parsley.

recipes.name: Chicken and Sweet Rice in a Pressure Cooker
ingredients: 1 (3-4 lb) whole chicken, excess fat trimmed (optional: skin removed)
1 ½ cups sweet rice (glutinous rice), rinsed and drained
4 cups water or (2 cups chicken stock and 2 cups water)
directions: Step 1: Add the rinsed and drained sweet rice to the pressure cooker/Instant Pot.
Step 2: Place the whole chicken on top of the rice.
Step 3: Add the scallion, garlic, and ginger to the pot.
Step 4: Pour in 4 cups of water or 2 cups of chicken stock and 2 cups of water.
Step 5: Close the lid tightly and select the "Poultry" function.
Step 6: Using the "-" button, reduce the cooking time to 25 minutes (for a 4-pound chicken). Adjust cooking time accordingly for different chicken sizes.  Add 5 minutes for every pound over 4 pounds.
Step 7: Allow the Instant Pot to naturally release pressure for 10-15 minutes after cooking is complete. The Instant Pot will automatically switch to the "Keep Warm" mode.
Step 8: Carefully open the lid and remove the chicken.
Step 9: (Optional) For a crispier nurungji (scorched rice), turn the Instant Pot back on for an additional 5 minutes. Let it sit for about 10 minutes before scraping off the nurungji.
Step 10: Remove and discard the ginger and scallion. Remove the garlic cloves if desired. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Chicken Gyro Bowl with Rice
ingredients: 2  8.5 oz  packages of Seeds of Change Quinoa & Brown Rice with Garlic
Marinade1/2  cup  Greek yogurt 1  tbsp  apple cider vinegar 4  tbsp  fresh lemon juice 1  tspkosher salt 1  tbsp  oregano 1/2  tsp  dried dill 2  tbsp  olive oil
For Tzatziki Sauce1/2  cup  Greek yogurt 2  cloves  garlic 1  tbsp  apple cider vinegar 1/4  cup  English cucumber, chopped 1/2  tsp  dill salt and pepper to taste

For Chicken Bowls2  8.5 oz  packages of Seeds of Change Quinoa & Brown Rice with Garlic 4  chicken breasts, pounded thin 1/2  cup  sliced grape tomatoes 1/2  cup  cucumbers, sliced 1/4  cup  crumbled feta cheese fresh chopped dill
directions: Whisk together all marinade ingredients. Place chicken in a container or a plastic bag and top with all of marinade. Make sure all chicken pieces are covered. Marinate overnight or for a few hours.

Preheat grill to medium high and oil the grates. Shake excess marinade off chicken and place on the grill. Cook until the internal temperature registers 165 degrees, about 8-10 minutes per side. This will depend on how thick your chicken is.
While chicken is grilling toss together all tzatziki sauce ingredients. Add salt and pepper to taste.
When chicken is done assemble bowls. Fill bottom of bowl with Seeds of Change Quinoa & Brown Rice with Garlic. Top with warm chicken, tomatoes, cucumbers, feta and top with sauce.

recipes.name: Southwestern Chicken with Beans and Rice
ingredients: 1 (3 1/2 lb) whole chicken, deboned and cut into pieces
2 (15 ounce) cans black beans or pinto beans, drained and rinsed
1 medium red bell pepper, seeded and finely chopped
1 medium jalapeño pepper, seeded and finely chopped
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Season chicken pieces with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Bake for 30 minutes, or until cooked through. Alternatively, cook chicken in a large skillet over medium-high heat with olive oil until golden brown and cooked through.
Step 2: While chicken cooks, prepare the beans and rice. In the same skillet (if pan-frying chicken), add onion, bell pepper, jalapeño, and garlic. Sauté for 5 minutes, or until softened.
Step 3: Stir in cumin, diced tomatoes, lemon juice, and beans. Add cooked chicken to the skillet.
Step 4: Pour in chicken broth and stir well. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook for 20 minutes.
Step 5: Uncover and cook for another 10 minutes, or until the chicken is tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.
Step 6: Serve chicken and bean mixture over cooked rice. Garnish with a green salad and tortilla chips, if desired.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of the finished Southwestern Chicken with Beans and Rice dish, garnished with fresh cilantro and served with a side of tortilla chips. The chicken should look juicy and tender, the beans and rice colorful, and the overall presentation appetizing.
scenes.text: Southwestern Chicken with Beans and Rice
scenes.voice_over: Welcome to today's recipe! We're making a vibrant and satisfying Southwestern Chicken with Beans and Rice. This dish is packed with flavor and protein, perfect for a weeknight dinner or a weekend fiesta.

scenes.image_prompt: Show all ingredients neatly arranged: whole chicken, rice, beans, olive oil, onion, bell pepper, jalapeno, garlic, diced tomatoes, cumin, lemon, salt and pepper.  Highlight the fresh ingredients.
scenes.voice_over: Let's gather our ingredients. We'll need a whole chicken, some cooked Texmati brown rice, black or pinto beans, olive oil, onion, bell pepper, jalapeno, garlic, diced tomatoes, ground cumin, lemon juice, salt, pepper and chicken broth

scenes.image_prompt: Show chicken being seasoned with salt, pepper, and garlic powder, then being placed in a preheated oven.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat your oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit. Season the chicken pieces generously with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Bake for 30 minutes, or until cooked through. Alternatively, you can pan-fry the chicken in olive oil until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the chopped onion, bell pepper, jalapeno, and garlic being sauteed in a skillet.
scenes.voice_over: While the chicken cooks, let's prepare the base. In a skillet, sauté the chopped onion, bell pepper, jalapeno, and garlic in olive oil for about 5 minutes, until softened.

scenes.image_prompt: Show cumin, diced tomatoes, lemon juice, and beans being added to the skillet with the sauteed vegetables.
scenes.voice_over: Now, add the ground cumin, diced tomatoes, lemon juice, and drained beans to the skillet. Stir everything together.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the cooked chicken being added to the skillet with the bean mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Once the chicken is cooked, add it to the skillet with the bean mixture.

scenes.image_prompt: Show chicken broth being poured into the skillet, the mixture being brought to a simmer, and then covered and cooked.
scenes.voice_over: Pour in the chicken broth and give it a good stir. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then cover and cook for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, uncover and cook for another 10 minutes to let the sauce thicken slightly.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the finished dish plated, with the chicken and bean mixture served over a bed of rice. Garnish with fresh cilantro and tortilla chips.
scenes.voice_over: Serve the delicious Southwestern Chicken and bean mixture over a bed of fluffy cooked rice. Garnish with fresh cilantro and tortilla chips for added crunch and flavor. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, leave the seeds in the jalapeño pepper.
If using canned beans, rinse them thoroughly to remove excess sodium.
Adjust the amount of chicken broth to achieve desired consistency.

recipes.name: Easy Crock-Pot Chicken and Rice with Green Beans
ingredients: 1 (10.75-ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup or cream of chicken soup
1 1/2 cups chicken broth (omit if cooking rice separately)
directions: Step 1: Place the halved chicken breasts in the slow cooker.
Step 2: In a bowl, whisk together the condensed soup (cream of mushroom or chicken) and water until smooth. Pour this mixture over the chicken in the slow cooker.
Step 3: Sprinkle the uncooked converted rice over the chicken and soup mixture.  Pour the chicken broth over the rice (omit broth if pre-cooking rice).
Step 4: Add the thawed green beans on top of the rice and season with freshly ground black pepper.
Step 5: Cover the slow cooker and cook on LOW for 5-6 hours, or until the chicken is cooked through and the rice is tender.
recipes.image_prompt: Professional food photography of Easy Crock-Pot Chicken and Rice with Green Beans on a white plate with garnish, high-resolution, studio lighting, shallow depth of field, soft natural lighting, rich colors and textures

scenes.image_prompt: Professional food photography of Easy Crock-Pot Chicken and Rice with Green Beans
scenes.voice_over: This recipe tutorial will show you how to make this delicious dish.

cooking_tips: For creamier rice, use cream of chicken soup.
If using regular long-grain rice, you may need to adjust the amount of liquid and cooking time.
Pre-cooking the rice separately can help prevent it from becoming mushy.
Add other vegetables like diced carrots or celery for extra flavor and nutrients.

recipes.name: Greek Chicken and Rice Casserole
ingredients: 1 (3-4 lb) whole broiler-fryer chicken, cut into pieces
directions: Step 1: In a large pot, place the whole chicken and 1 whole onion. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is cooked through, about 30-40 minutes.
Step 2: Remove the chicken and onion from the pot. Reserve 2 1/2 cups of the cooking broth. Set the chicken aside to cool slightly. Discard the whole onion.
Step 3: Preheat oven to 200°C (350°F).
Step 4: Shred the cooked chicken from the bones and discard the skin and bones.
Step 5: In a large casserole dish, spread the coarsely chopped onions evenly across the bottom.
Step 6: Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese, chopped parsley, and rice over the onions.
Step 7: Top with the shredded chicken and pour 1 1/2 cups of the reserved chicken broth over the mixture.
Step 8: Dot the top with butter.
Step 9: Bake for 45 minutes.
Step 10: In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and the remaining 1 cup of reserved chicken broth.
Step 11: Pour the egg mixture over the casserole and bake for an additional 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the casserole is set.
recipes.image_prompt: Professional food photography of Greek Chicken and Rice Casserole on a white plate with garnish, high-resolution, studio lighting, shallow depth of field, soft natural lighting, rich colors and textures

video_script.title: Greek Chicken and Rice Casserole
video_script.description: A comforting and flavorful Greek-inspired casserole featuring tender chicken, fluffy rice, feta cheese, and fresh herbs.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a finished Greek Chicken and Rice Casserole, golden brown on top, with melted feta cheese visible and garnished with fresh parsley. Steam gently rising.
scenes.voice_over: Craving a hearty and delicious meal?  Today, we're making Greek Chicken and Rice Casserole! It's packed with flavor and perfect for a family dinner.

scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: a whole chicken, onions, long-grain rice, feta cheese, fresh parsley, butter, chicken broth, and eggs.

scenes.image_prompt: A large pot on a stovetop with a whole chicken and a whole onion submerged in boiling water.
scenes.voice_over: Place the whole chicken and one whole onion in a large pot, cover with water, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30-40 minutes, or until cooked through.

scenes.image_prompt: Shredded cooked chicken in a bowl.
scenes.voice_over: Remove the chicken and onion from the pot, reserving 2 1/2 cups of the broth. Let the chicken cool, then shred it, discarding the skin and bones. Discard the whole onion.

scenes.image_prompt: A casserole dish with layers of chopped onions, crumbled feta cheese, chopped parsley, and rice.
scenes.voice_over: Preheat oven to 350°F (200°C). In a casserole dish, layer chopped onions, feta, parsley, and rice.

scenes.image_prompt: Casserole dish with shredded chicken on top of the rice mixture, chicken broth being poured over it, and dots of butter on top.
scenes.voice_over: Top with shredded chicken and pour 1 1/2 cups of reserved broth over it. Dot with butter and bake for 45 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: A bowl with whisked eggs and chicken broth.
scenes.voice_over: Whisk together the eggs and remaining chicken broth.

scenes.image_prompt: Casserole dish with the egg mixture poured over it, baking in the oven.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the egg mixture over the casserole and bake for another 30 minutes, until golden brown and set.

scenes.image_prompt: The finished Greek Chicken and Rice Casserole, golden brown, garnished with fresh parsley, being served onto a plate with a serving spoon.
scenes.voice_over: Serve hot and enjoy! This casserole is about 500 calories per serving with 40 grams of protein, 30 grams of carbs, and 25 grams of fat.  It's great as a weeknight dinner or for a special occasion.

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs instead of a whole chicken.
If you don't have fresh parsley, you can substitute with 1 tablespoon of dried parsley.
Add a pinch of dried oregano or thyme to the casserole for extra depth of flavor.
Serve the casserole with a side of Greek salad or roasted vegetables.

recipes.name: Sweet Chili Chicken With Asian Vegetable Rice
ingredients: 3/4 cup Thai sweet chili sauce (Mae Ploy or Sriracha with a little honey or brown sugar added)
2/3 cup diagonally sliced sugar snap pea (optional)
directions: In a large sealable plastic bag, combine the soy sauce, vinegar, cilantro, ginger and garlic
Add chicken and refrigerate 1 to 4 hours.Preheat oven to 450 degrees
Line a baking sheet with foil
Spray foil with nonstick spray
Remove chicken from marinade and drain; discard marinade
Place sweet chili sauce in a large bowl add chicken and toss to coat
Place chicken on baking sheet and bake 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.Meanwhile, cook rice according to package directions, omitting butter or margarine
While rice is cooking, combine rice vinegar with carrot, snap peas (if using), bell pepper, sesame seeds, and salt
Stir mixture into freshly cooked rice and adjust seasonings to taste.Slice chicken diagonally and serve over rice
Sprinkle green onions over top.

recipes.name: Sesame chicken and veggie fried rice
ingredients: 1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breast chicken
2 tablespoons sesame seeds (plus more for topping)
1/2 cup soy sauce (gluten free if necessary)
1 tablespoon chili garlic paste (or more to heat preference)
About 2 quarts peanut or sunflower oil for frying
1/4 cup peanut or sunflower oil, divided
directions: Combine cornstarch and eggs in a medium bowl and whisk until smooth. Add chicken and stir to coat. Place in refrigerator for up to 24 hours or just while you make the sauce.

Whisk cornstarch and 1/4 cup water in a small bowl and set aside. Saute garlic, ginger, and sesame seeds with sesame oil in a saucepan or wok over medium heat for 3 to 4 minutes until browned. Add remaining ingredients from stock to chili garlic paste and bring to a boil over medium high heat, stirring often. Continue boiling until the sauce is just starting to thicken a little, about 10 minutes. Pour in water/cornstarch while stirring and stir until thick. Remove from heat and cover to keep warm.

Heat a deep fryer filled with recommended amount of oil (alternatively you can use at least 2 inches of oil in a dutch oven or wok instead) to 350 degrees F (180 C). Remove chicken slurry from fridge and drop a few pieces at a time into hot oil. Fry on each side for about 2 minutes until golden and crispy. Remove to a plate lined with paper towels to drain. Continue until all chicken is cooked.
Toss chicken in warm sauce and serve immediately topped with pomegranate arils and extra sesame seeds along with the rice.

Veggie Fried Rice : Add 3 tablespoons oil, garlic, and vegetables to large skillet or wok and cook until veggies are starting to soften, about 3 minutes. Add broth and continue stirring until most of the liquid is evaporated. Make a space in the center of the pan and pour in 1 tablespoon more oil and crack in eggs. Quickly scramble and break into small pieces as it cooks then stir into veggies. Now add soy sauce, sesame oil, and rice and toss to coat. Cook for about 5 minutes until it starts to darken and gets hot. Remove from heat and season to taste with salt then serve with chicken.

recipes.name: One-Pot Teriyaki Chicken and Rice
directions: Step 1: Marinate the Chicken: In a bowl, combine 4 tablespoons soy sauce, 4 tablespoons mirin, 4 tablespoons sake, 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil, and 2 tablespoons sugar. Mix well and taste, adjusting seasoning as needed. Marinate the chicken thighs in the mixture for 20 minutes.

Step 2: Sauté Aromatics: Pour the marinade (without the chicken) into the pressure cooker. Add the crushed garlic and ginger slice. Select the "Sauté" function and bring the mixture to a boil. Boil for 30 seconds to allow the alcohol in the sake to evaporate.

Step 3: Pressure Cook Chicken and Rice: Place the chicken thighs skin-side up in the pressure cooker. Insert a steamer rack and place a heat-proof bowl containing the rice on top. Pour 1 cup of water over the rice, ensuring it's fully submerged. Close the lid and cook on high pressure for 6 minutes. Allow for a full natural pressure release (about 10 minutes). Carefully open the lid.

Step 4: Thicken Sauce: Remove the chicken thighs and set aside. Fluff the rice and set aside. Discard the ginger and garlic. Select the "Sauté" function again. Taste the sauce and adjust seasoning if needed. In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch and water. Gradually add the cornstarch mixture to the sauce, stirring constantly, until desired thickness is achieved.

Step 5 (Optional): Broil Chicken: Preheat oven to 450°F. Brush the chicken thighs with the thickened teriyaki sauce. Place the chicken on a wire rack set over a baking sheet and broil for 5-8 minutes, or until slightly caramelized.
Step 6: Serve: Serve the chicken thighs immediately over rice.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a one-pot teriyaki chicken and rice dish with glistening, crispy-skinned chicken thighs nestled amongst fluffy white rice. Use a dark, rustic wooden background and matte black chopsticks. Garnish with thinly sliced green onions and toasted sesame seeds. Shoot from a slightly overhead angle, with a shallow depth of field focusing on a chicken thigh in the foreground. Emphasize warm, inviting lighting that highlights the glossy teriyaki glaze and steam rising from the dish, creating a cozy, comforting mood.

Adjust the amount of sugar in the teriyaki sauce to your preference.

recipes.name: Shredded chicken rice cups
ingredients: 2 tablespoons flat-leaf parsley leaves, finely chopped
directions: Bring 3 cups cold water to the boil in a saucepan over high heat
Add rice and crumble over stock
Return to the boil, stirring
Reduce heat to low
Add chicken
Cover
Simmer for 10 minutes
Remove pan from heat
Stand, covered, for 10 minutes.Remove chicken
Set aside to cool
Transfer rice to a large bowl
Shred chicken.Combine vinegar and mustard
Pour over rice
Stir with a fork to combine
Add onions, celery, capsicum, parsley and chicken
Toss to combine.Spoon warm rice mixture into lettuce cups
Top with cashews and serve.

recipes.name: Quick & Easy Chicken Curry with Rice
ingredients: 1 cup chicken broth or 1 tablespoon chicken base dissolved in 1 cup hot water
1/2 tablespoon dried minced onion or 3 tablespoons diced fresh onion
directions: Step 1: In a 2-inch deep pan, combine chicken broth (or water and chicken base) and cubed chicken. Place pan on medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add curry powder, chili powder, minced onion (dried or fresh), minced garlic, and crushed red pepper flakes to the pan. Stir well to coat the chicken with the spices.
Step 3: Cook chicken uncovered, stirring frequently, until cooked through. Remove chicken from heat and cover to keep warm.

Step 4: In a separate pan, cook rice according to package directions. Substitute the cooking water with the drippings/liquid from the chicken pan (approximately 1/2 cup). Supplement with additional water as needed to reach the required amount for cooking the rice (approximately 1 1/3 cups total).
Step 5: Once the rice is cooked, add it to the pan with the chicken. Stir well to combine and heat through for about 3 minutes over medium-high heat.

recipes.name: Portuguese chicken with rice
ingredients: 100g green beans, trimmed, cut into 2cm lengths
Fresh coriander leaves and lemon wedges, to serve
directions: Preheat grill on high
Halve capsicum
Remove and discard seeds and membrane
Cut each piece in half
Place capsicum, skin-side up, on a tray lined with foil
Grill for 5 to 7 minutes or until charred and tender
Place in a snap-lock bag
Seal
Set aside for 10 minutes
Peel and discard skin from capsicum
Set aside to cool for 5 minutes.Place capsicum, lemon juice, paprika, coriander, garlic and 1 tablespoon oil in a food processor
Process until smooth
Transfer mixture to a shallow glass or ceramic dish
Add chicken
Toss to coat
Refrigerate overnight, if time permits.Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced
Line a baking tray with baking paper
Drizzle chicken with remaining oil
Season lightly with pepper
Toss to coat
Heat a frying pan over medium-high heat
Add chicken
Cook for 2 to 3 minutes each side or until golden
Transfer to prepared baking tray
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until just cooked through
Remove from oven

Stand, covered, for 5 minutes to rest.Meanwhile, cook rice in a large saucepan of boiling water, following packet directions, adding carrot for the last 5 minutes and corn and beans in the last 2 minutes, or until just tender
Drain.Thickly slice chicken
Spoon rice mixture onto plates
Top with chicken
Serve with coriander and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Hearty Chicken and Rice Soup
ingredients: 1 (3-3.5 lb) whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces
directions: Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add diced onions and sauté until translucent.
Step 3: Add minced garlic and sauté for about 2 minutes, being careful not to burn.
Step 4: Place chicken pieces in the pot and season with salt and pepper.
Step 5: Add water and chopped carrots to the pot.
Step 6: Bring the mixture to a gentle boil, then reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 25 minutes.
Step 7: Remove the cooked chicken from the pot and set aside on a plate. Turn off the heat.
Step 8: Let the chicken cool for about 10 minutes, or until it's easy to handle.
Step 9: Remove and discard the skin and bones from the chicken.
Step 10: Chop the chicken into bite-sized pieces.
Step 11: Add the chopped chicken and rice to the pot.
Step 12: Return the pot to medium-high heat and bring to a slow boil.
Step 13: Reduce heat to medium, cover, and simmer for 13 minutes.
Step 14: Check the rice for doneness. Simmer for a few more minutes if needed, until cooked through.
Step 15: Adjust salt to taste.
Step 16: Remove the pot from the heat and stir in the chopped parsley.
Step 17: Ladle the soup into bowls and drizzle each serving with fresh lemon juice.

recipes.name: Sticky Coconut Chicken with Chili Glaze and Coconut Rice
ingredients: 1/4 cup canned coconut milk (stir before measuring)
directions: 1. Prepare the Chicken: Rinse the chicken breasts and pat them dry.

2. Marinate the Chicken: In a large bowl, combine the coconut milk, ginger, black pepper, and hot chili flakes. Add the chicken breasts, ensuring they are fully coated. Cover the bowl tightly and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or up to 24 hours.

3. Prepare the Glaze: In a 2- to 3-quart saucepan, combine the rice vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and crushed red pepper flakes. Bring the mixture to a boil over high heat, stirring occasionally. Reduce the heat to medium and continue to cook, stirring often, until the glaze has thickened and reduced to about 1/2 cup, approximately 8-10 minutes. Set aside.

4. Start the Rice: While the glaze is reducing, bring the 3/4 cup coconut milk, water, garlic, and salt to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add the rice, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes, or until all the liquid is absorbed and the rice is cooked through.

5. Cook the Chicken: Preheat grill or broiler to high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade, discarding the marinade. Grill or broil the chicken for 5-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through and no longer pink inside.

6. Glaze and Serve: Transfer the cooked chicken to a serving platter. Pour the chili glaze evenly over the chicken. Garnish with sliced green onions. Fluff the cooked rice with a fork and stir in the reserved 2 tablespoons of coconut milk, chopped pineapple, and Thai basil. Serve the chicken with the coconut rice.

scenes.voice_over: Serve the Sticky Coconut Chicken over the coconut rice. Garnish with green onions.  Enjoy! This dish pairs well with steamed vegetables for a complete meal. Each serving has approximately 500 calories, 35g protein, 60g carbs, and 20g fat.

cooking_tips: For a spicier glaze, add more chili flakes.
If grilling, soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes before using to prevent them from burning.
Leftover chicken and rice can be stored separately in airtight containers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

recipes.name: Lemon Herb Chicken and Rice
ingredients: ½ teaspoon dried Italian herb blend
directions: Step 1: Combine the dried Italian herbs, garlic powder, onion powder, and paprika in a small bowl.
Step 2: Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over the chicken breasts. Season generously with salt, pepper, and the prepared herb blend.
Step 3: Set the Instant Pot to the "Sauté" function and add the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Brown the chicken breasts for 1-2 minutes per side. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
Step 4: Add the butter to the Instant Pot. Once melted, add the minced garlic and sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Step 5: Add the rinsed rice, ½ teaspoon of Italian herb blend, salt, and pepper to the pot. Stir to combine.
Step 6: Pour in the chicken broth and stir well.
Step 7: Place a steam rack inside the Instant Pot. Arrange the browned chicken breasts on the rack.
Step 8: Close the lid and set the Instant Pot to "Pressure Cook" or "Manual" for 5 minutes. Allow for a natural pressure release for 5 minutes, then manually release any remaining pressure.
Step 9: Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Fluff the rice with a fork.
Step 10: Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the chicken and rice. Serve immediately.

scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making a delicious and healthy one-pot meal: Lemon Herb Chicken and Rice in the Instant Pot. It's quick, easy, and packed with flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of all ingredients neatly arranged on a countertop. Chicken breasts are in the center, surrounded by bowls of spices, herbs, rice, lemon, butter, garlic, and olive oil.
scenes.voice_over: Here's what you'll need: four boneless, skinless chicken breasts, olive oil, Italian herbs, garlic powder, paprika, onion powder, salt, pepper, long-grain white rice, butter, minced garlic, chicken broth, and a fresh lemon.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of a small bowl with the combined dry spices: Italian herbs, garlic powder, paprika, and onion powder.
scenes.voice_over: First, combine the Italian herbs, garlic powder, paprika, and onion powder in a small bowl. This aromatic blend will season both the chicken and the rice.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken breasts being drizzled with olive oil and seasoned with the spice blend, salt, and pepper.
scenes.voice_over: Drizzle olive oil over the chicken breasts. Season generously with salt, pepper, and the prepared herb blend. Make sure to coat each chicken breast evenly.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken breasts browning in the Instant Pot on the "Sauté" function.
scenes.voice_over: Set your Instant Pot to the "Sauté" function. Add olive oil and brown the chicken for 1-2 minutes per side. This adds a nice depth of flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Rice and herbs being sautéed in melted butter and minced garlic in the Instant Pot.
scenes.voice_over: Add butter to the pot, followed by minced garlic. Sauté for about 30 seconds until fragrant. Add the rinsed rice and some more Italian herbs, salt, and pepper. Stir well.

scenes.image_prompt: Chicken broth being poured into the Instant Pot with the rice.
scenes.voice_over: Pour in the chicken broth and give everything a good stir. Ensure the rice is evenly distributed in the pot.

scenes.image_prompt: Seared chicken breasts arranged on a steam rack inside the Instant Pot, above the rice and broth mixture.
scenes.voice_over: Place a steam rack inside the pot. Arrange the browned chicken breasts on the rack. Close the lid and set the Instant Pot to "Pressure Cook" or "Manual" for 5 minutes.  After cooking, allow a natural pressure release for 5 minutes, then manually release any remaining pressure.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of fluffy rice being fluffed with a fork after pressure cooking.

cooking_tips: For a richer flavor, use bone-in, skin-on chicken breasts. Adjust the cooking time accordingly.

If you don't have an Instant Pot, you can cook this recipe on the stovetop. Sauté the chicken and rice as directed, then add the broth, bring to a boil, reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the chicken is cooked to an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C).
Add other vegetables like chopped carrots, celery, or bell peppers to the rice for added flavor and nutrition.

recipes.name: Chicken Biryani
ingredients: 1 lb Chicken, cut into serving pieces
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Fried Onions: Slice the onions and toss them with cornstarch. Deep fry in hot oil until light brown and crispy. Set aside.

Step 2: Marinate the Chicken: In a large bowl, combine the yogurt, Degi Mirch, coriander powder, cinnamon powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, crushed garlic, crushed ginger, cardamom powder, mace, chopped cilantro, and chopped mint. Mix well.

Step 3: Add Chicken and Onions to Marinade: Add the chicken pieces and a handful of the fried onions to the marinade. Mix thoroughly, cover, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or preferably 2-3 hours.

Step 4: Parboil the Rice: Rinse the rice under cold water. In a large pot, heat oil and add cumin seeds, black cardamom, cloves, and bay leaves. Once they sputter, add water and salt. Bring to a boil, then add the rice. Cook until the rice is half-cooked (grains should offer slight resistance when pressed). Drain and set aside.

Step 5: Cook the Chicken: Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven. Add the marinated chicken and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the oil separates from the masala. Add 1/4 cup of water to create a light gravy.
Step 6: Infuse Saffron Milk: Warm the milk and add saffron strands. Let it sit until the milk turns a rich yellow color.

Step 7: Layer and Steam (Dum): Spread the parboiled rice over the cooked chicken. Pour the saffron milk evenly over the rice. Sprinkle the remaining fried onions, chopped cilantro, and mint leaves over the rice. Drizzle with ghee.

Step 8: Finish Cooking: Cover the pot tightly and cook over low heat for 10-12 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and fluffy. Alternatively, cover the pot with a cloth and lid to create a tighter seal for steaming.
Step 9: Serve: Serve hot with vinegar onions and yogurt.

recipes.name: Creamy Santa Fe Chicken and Rice Casserole
ingredients: 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes, drained (reserve juice)
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Step 2: Cook rice according to package directions, substituting an equal amount of chicken broth plus the reserved tomato juice for the water.
Step 3: While the rice is cooking, combine the green chilies, black olives, diced tomatoes, corn, and cooked chicken in a large bowl.
Step 4: In a separate bowl or blender, combine the cottage cheese, Greek yogurt, 1 cup of chicken broth, salt, garlic powder, and taco seasoning. Blend until smooth.
Step 5: Once the rice is cooked, add it to the chicken mixture.
Step 6: Gently fold in the cottage cheese mixture until well combined.
Step 7: Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Step 8: Bake for 45 minutes, or until heated through and bubbly.

scenes.voice_over: Craving a comforting and flavorful dish? This Creamy Santa Fe Chicken and Rice Casserole is packed with protein and Southwestern spices. It's easy to make and perfect for a weeknight dinner.

cooking_tips: For a spicier dish, add a pinch of cayenne pepper or a few dashes of your favorite hot sauce to the cottage cheese mixture.
If you don't have an immersion blender, a regular blender works fine. Just be careful when blending hot liquids.
Leftovers can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
